# maximumSize

**Instance Property**

A maximum size for the image.

## Declaration

```swift
var maximumSize: CGSize { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGSizeZero]. Setting a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CGSize/width] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CGSize/height] of zero makes the size unconstrained on that dimension. If the image exceeds [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentUnavailableConfiguration-swift.struct/ImageProperties-swift.struct/maximumSize] size on either dimension, the view reduces its size proportionately, maintaining aspect ratio.
